reviewText: Lecturer is so weak
Boring and not su enthusiastic professor.
The most boring prof. Stick with Yale for online courses! He read of a PowerPoint.

The course slides are good. But the subject presentation and explanation is very poor. The instructor just reads from some notes, and never explains anything. Moreover, the instructor often misspells many terms and struggles to recall terminology previously read out by him in some earlier video.Overall, I would not recommend this course to anyone.
Not good teaching. Poor explanation. Not straightforward  sentences

This course demands way too much for a coursera course. Minimum 15 hours a week, if you have a solid foundation in Anatomy. I have a MA and work in biotech. I'm not a stupid person, but I couldn't keep up. I gave up. This is the first thing I've given up on in a long time. I've already paid. I feel cheated. It is not comparable to other coursera courses. Be forewarned. Taking this ONE coursera course is like having a 20-25 hour a week part-time job. Don't plan on having a life or doing anything except this course. If you work full-time, I would strongly recommend against attempting it.
Typos everywhere, the intro animation is extremely annoying.
Expected more information
interesting course. However it was repetitive and complex and didn't really explain how an MRI at sea works. A lot of what was on the tests were not covered in the course.
The course entails important basics of neuroscience. However, the video content was not much different from what one usually can read a textbook, thus making them reduntant and not easy to follow.

Course was a good introduction. But Speaker appeared nervous and it seemed a tad odd that he would be looking left at some content - further, just reading out the slide is useful in some cases , but in others what might help is content around the slide to provide greater explanation of what is on the slide. But overall it was still good.

Very interesting, but very dry. I'm glad I took it. It would have been more stimulating with animations instead of simple powerpoint slides. The powerpoints were sometimes hard to read (labels on images, etc.). Arnold is clearly knowledgeable, but unfortunately doesn't do much to draw you in.
Not always 100% clear to be honest.
I think there could b more explaining about this interesting topic. Somewhere along this course I just fell there was too much dependency on the slides.
Too complicated. Jumps from simple neurobio to really complicated physics behind various scanning equipment. Could have taken some time to go through the basics
It was a great course which gave clear overview of all imaging techniques with their background and practical usage

En general me ha gustado el curso, pero creo que cambiar√≠a la introducci√≥n. Hay mucho de fisiolog√≠a del cerebro, lo que podr√≠a acortarse para a√±adir m√°s sobre las t√©cnicas de neuroimagen. It was a good course and a basic introduction of the imaging techniques.

El curso es un poco aburrido, ya que en muchas ocasiones el profesor solo lee tal cual lo que tiene en su presentaci√≥n, seria bueno se√±alar y mostrar de mejor manera algunas gr√°ficas que pueden ser interesantes
The instructor was less enthusiastic about the course. The course materials were fine. The intro sounds to all videos were highly irritating.
The reading in each module is pretty boring... Hard to keep track of the lectures.
I did not really like the instructor. Even though the course was informative, the instruction bandwidth was rather mundane. However, I'm still thankful for the opportunity!
This course was good but focused mainly on MRI and fMRI techniques. I feel that other techniques for neuroimaging lacked depth of information.
The lectures are not structured enough, in order to obtain information you have to constantly stop them and write down.
Excellent brief up about different structural and functional approaches of brain imaging, but the mechanism of operations of each imaging studies should have been elaborated more in depth
It's not that helpful even for people of fields other than neuroscience. But good to have an overview of terminologies and some basic points.

The course was needlessly basic. Most people who come to take this course have a minimal background in neuroscience, therefore the first module is probably very basic information that really has no applications for the later modules. Also, the presentation animation was... well, it would have been better if there had been none. I was hoping for a little more depth in the topic, and certainly more audiovisual tools help understand the physical fundamentals of neuroimaging.
Good coverage of topics but the way it's explained is very theoretical and technical. It would be better if it was taught using simpler languages and perhaps using charts diagrams and examples.
THE COURSE CONTENT LACKS PRACTICAL VIEW
The topics are interesting but presented in a not too engaging way.
The course provide good intro to fMRI study although the lectures are a little plain.
the course is designed Fabolous for the beginers
I‚Äã like it but sometimes i feel teacher is reading and not explaining and i believe things could be explain more easily sometimes. However, i recommend the course!
in some videos the materials are difficult and the explanation is too brief and quick. Overall a well-designed course
Great course!
I think more images or videos would enhance the comprehension of the course. The rest was perfect! Thank you so much for everything :)
informative, concise and very well organized course!
Great course

I loved the content of the course. The first modules were easier and very informative. The last two modules were challenging as all the information was practically new for me, but it was so well explained I can confidently say I have finished this course with new knowledge.
very intresting
Explanations of some topics were not good enough. But overall, very good course with satisfactory explanations in the relevant topics
What an amazing course!
I enjoyed the course.
The topics were great but my expected learning outcomes were more of reading and interpreting rather than the physics behind science. Over all, fulfilling course.
Me hubiera gustado que continuar√° todo el curso con las preguntas dentro de los videos a manera de repaso. √âsto hubiera sido muy √∫til en los √∫ltimos temas dada su complejidad.

It would be better if the principles of MRI and the process of MRI are explained in clearer terms and in a step-by-step manner. But the overall experience is great as the course comprehensively discussed different concepts.
Great course! One note: please consider removing the MRI noise from the begging of each video!
bien
It's better to cover more fundamentals in an easier way.
Fascinating but you should really be interested in the topic. Worth the time.
Covers the basics of neuroimaging techniques.  I am also interested in statistics and analysis of the time series data.
amazing course , but it have to be little more explainable that student can easily get the concept.
Very informative, but the lecturer needs to be more engaging.
Muy buen curso :)
The course is amazing good for people who have an interest in neuroscience and understanding various neuroimaging techniques.
It was really good!!
Very helpful

There was a lot of great information regarding neuroimaging. Starting this course, I was hoping that it would be based on how to "read" images successfully, basics of neuro lesions, defining a lesion, its position and moving further for a diagnosis. However, I would like to thank prof Bakker, who has explained everything throughly over this course. Dr AA

Great intro course! I was expecting it to go more in depth but the amount presented was a good amount for me to have a general understanding of neuroimaging. I have a neuroscience background so the first two weeks of material were very easy but the latter half was interesting. Thank you
This was loads of fun. It's a bit difficult for somebody who is new to the subject though.
Useful but dense.

This course gives a broad overview of some of the well-known neuroimaging techniques. Their advantages, disadvantages, and things to keep in mind while designing an fMRI experiment are well explained.
It's basic, making it a great way to approach neuroscience. It would be much better if it was subtitled in more languages.
The course is nice and detailed!
the course content is satisfactory although more in sites in MRI data analysis would have been beneficial!
Nothing about EEG and and CT, MEG
It was a very good course for me, in order to get deeper  in Neuroscience understanding
A great course.

Professor Bakker taught at an ideal speed. The content difficulty progressed at a good speed. I've studied Psychology and had rudimentary knowledge of neuroimaging and it fascinated me. This course interested me because of that. I liked the questions asked after every video, it helped me to think over what i've just studied. The quizzes were great too.I faced problem with the physics part of the course since I studied that in school. Otherwise it was great!
A good platform to start learning about neuroimaging with a practical approach

Very well done. Great structure. However, I think the course could make a better use of time and delve less into the physical basis of the imaging methods and more in the practical uses. Sometimes it's a bit difficult to keep up with the physics basis when not from a physics background. Great experience overall
This course aptly provides the necessary information required to understand the basics of neuroimaging.

Good course for general overview of a very complicated subject - MRI and the human brain.  The lack of pressure to perform coursework allows one to absorb the material and discuss at individual pace. This was not time wasted. Particularly useful for computer scientists who have minimal concept of neuroscience.  Thank you.

This course provides sufficient introductory information regarding different neuroimaging techniques but the modules regarding various techniques were dealt a bit vaguely which required further referring to some books and youtube videos. I suggest that the second half of the course can be improved. Otherwise, this course is a good start to learn about neuroimaging and encourages to progress deeply into the subject by providing valuable further readings at the end of the course.
The course content is very good to learn the fundamentals of Neuro Imaging.

The lecturer reads to much of slides/ or papers, instead of deeply explaining meanings. Great content of skills and learning overall. The videos could be a little shorter, considering the repetition of explanations. Perhaps, they could be split and made as learning and a review afterwards, if that makes sense and, in case this could be helpful for other students/ learners. Enjoyed the introduction at the first week, even though it seemed to have a bigger content then the others 3 weeks, it provided helpful information of Neuroscience in a global perspective.
It was a high quality course that cleared a lot of my concepts in the basics of neuroimaging.I felt at certain times the speed was too fast and adequate glossing over important concepts was not done.
It was an aesthetic experience for me as a naive neurobiology learner. The great structure of this course hopefully helps me in my later career.
It is really good for beginners who wish to understand Neuroimaging.
Great course! Though maybe I'd recommend to vary a little bit more the speed and tone to keep focus, sometimes I needed to distract myself for a bit before returning.
the instructor need to improve his explanation skills, but he was really great
a bit hard

It's good for beginners but it's better to know basic chemistry when you go into it. The later stages include jargon that won't be known by someone who hasn't studied chemistry even a bit, although it is mnageable nonetheless.

This is an excellent course for those looking to learn more about the tools used in imaging and understanding the brain. I would note, however, the third and fourth weeks start to bring in some physics concepts that I had not learned previously, so it was a bit challenging to understand all the material. It was a fascinating course!
I learned a lot of information and the course was very interesting.Maybe, the next edition of this course, the information can be in Spanish.Congratulations
This course is really introductory, and a good starting point for advanced courses.

nice class for achieving a basic understanding of brain imaging. a reference to functional imaging using microscopy (e.g. lsm or 2p combined with calcium sensor) would have been great for me personally.

A good course with a lot of information explained in a generally user-friendly format. Frequently, the instructor simply reads from the slides, but it is obvious  he is extremely intelligent and able to communicate complex topics well. The course is geared more toward researchers than I was anticipating, with large sections devoted to experiment design and the ways the techniques actually work. For my purposes, I was hoping to see more of a focus on connections to clinical presentation and applications in a hospital setting.
Some supplements could have been included in the course. Except that, the course material was well organised and very informative. I really enjoyed doing the course.
A good introductory course for anyone new in this field

This course packed an enormous amount of information!! The one complaint I have is that the section on the mechanics of the fMRI machine was quite confusing, especially as I have a very limited understanding of physics to begin with. That said, I was able to find a video on youtube to supplement my understanding.
The course was good. I had a great time during the lessons. Some of the topics were really tough but they were explained in a way that can a non specialist to understand it.
It's little bit boring , but it is informative and worth to study.

I was expecting a bit more of how to interpret neuroimaging; and even as I did not find exactly what I was looking for, the course showed me some very interesting stuff. A few stars less for those personal expectatives raised, but recovered mostly for all the deep and interesting info in other neuro and tecnical topics. I will recomend the course.
Brilliant , Easy to understand , using it in conjunction with other neuroscience courses. Help build knowledge base .

This course is very interesting. It does require some background in physics on magnetism but that does not deminish the greatness of the course. The only thing that is somewhat annoying is the lecturers tendency to look to his left and our right to read from a screen the lecture notes.
better if it has more information n more detail

I really enjoyed the course. It is a good introduction into the world of neuroimaging. The videos are short and informative and the course is well organized. Therefore it is the first course I actually completed and didn't abandon half way. :)
Good course on imaging techniques with a short introduction, however, much less comprehensive than other neurobiology courses on Coursera
I enjoyed this course as it was informative and provoked thought. It can be made better if the videos were split into smaller blocks instead of combining two topics.
You get everything as per the title. Slightly short course. Can go in greater depth and be harder
Good introduction to the theme. Gives a big picture to the recent developments in the area.
thanx sir
ok

My knowledge on neuroimaging is at a beginner's level. The lectures has helped me understand the fundamentals on MRI, fMRI, DTI, and MRS, ideas of which were generally new to me. This course has definitely helped me further my interest in neurosciences and also added new skills that are helpful in my research career.

I particularly enjoy Dr. Bakker's approach to teaching this course, the information was categorized and organized in a way that would ease a freshly graduated biology student into this specialization. His repetition of the general idea at the beginning of each module helped in keeping the information fresh and easy to recall. The quizzes weren't too difficult and were directly tied to the modules he had previously explained. I particularly enjoyed the discussion prompts for they allowed us to ponder further.Thank you professor Bakker.

Very educational and informative. It greatly prepares you to think very critically using specialized intended meaning which prepares you for advanced reserach experience.

Although I have extended the course a little, I completed it in 5 weeks. I am a psychology student and I am interested in brain studies. This course is a complete introductory lecture, it covers everything from the basics. It was a very nice and productive course.
This course is explained very clearly, it's easy to follow, and it covers the basics of Neuroimaging fairly well.

I am an aspiring neurophysiologist with background in electronics engineering and computer science. Further, it has also nudged me to pursue more in-depth courses in neuroimaging. Thank you prof. Arnold Bakker for the lucid lectures, and the coursera team for making this accessible from anywhere in the globe !

Absolutely brilliant course. Since I'm from a computer science background, this course helped e a lot to learn the basics of neuroscience concepts. Clearly, explanation and teaching slides are very useful. Thank you very much for the great course.
